title: CHIROREVOLUTION
description: Find out the differences between structural and traditional chropratic and how both can be beneficial.
cleaned_text: Before we get into our focus, we want to be clear on what the traditional chiropractor is attempting to accomplish with his or her care. Typically the chiropractor tries to: Most of the cases that we see in our office, which are commonly referred from other local chiropractors and medical doctors, are for the correction of significant Structural Shifts of the spine. The presence of one or more Structural Shifts of the spine is typically the underlying cause of many symptoms or what structural doctors refer to as Secondary Conditions. Structural correction focuses on the underlying cause - the Structural Shift.
